posts.name: Subramaniam R
posts.cooked:
I am aware that 6.3 will include faster back and restore. Any idea of the expected performance improvement ?

This document states the new restore is expected to be 2x faster, but i think 2x is still way slower. if 1TB restore takes about 24 hours then new restore will take 12 hours. This is still very slow.

Any benchmarks will be very useful.

link_counts.title: Design and Implementation of a Performant Restore System in FDB

posts.name: Meng Xu
posts.cooked:
We are still evaluating the performance, scalability, visibility and reliability of the new fast restore system and will release the result when the new fast restore system is production ready.

The new restore system will be in experimental feature (not production-ready) in 6.3.

posts.name: Oleg Samarin
posts.cooked:
Hello!

I have some ideas how to make fdb restore faster. Where may I discuss them?

posts.name: Steve Atherton
posts.cooked:
These forums are for discussion of anything related to FDB.

If you have ideas for improving the new restore system, this thread or the design thread would be good places to comment.

link_counts.title: Design and Implementation of a Performant Restore System in FDB

posts.name: Oleg Samarin
posts.cooked:
Hello!

I’ve compiled fdb from the github master and I’d like to make some testing of the fast restore. How can I run it?

posts.name: Meng Xu
posts.cooked:
Hi Oleg,

It is not ready yet. It does not have fault tolerance yet – although faults in FDB cluster are allowed, fault in fast restore process will require fast restore start over.
I don’t recommend to use fast restore right now.

posts.name: Oleg Samarin
posts.cooked: Thank you for response. I’m just testing the partitional backup, and I see that using the fast restore is the only option for restoring from the partitioned backup, isn’t it?

link_counts.title: Fast Restore tool for performant restore

posts.name: Meng Xu
posts.cooked:
If you only want to check the correctness of the partitional backup, you can use FileConverter to covert the partitioned backup format into old backup format.

The Fileconverter is at https://github.com/apple/foundationdb/blob/5f06c20d08dde0fae7e06ae0f709cc089cfc2194/fdbbackup/FileConverter.actor.cpp#L2-L3

The caveat is that Fileconverter is only a single thread process. It can be slow.

posts.name: Oleg Samarin
posts.cooked:
The most important thing it is lack of status command

[oleg@oleg2 devops]$ fastrestore_tool status --dest_cluster_file clusters/fdb.cluster
[TODO][ERROR] FastRestore does not support RESTORE_STATUS yet!
[oleg@oleg2 devops]$

So I can’not see if the restore is working

posts.name: Meng Xu
posts.cooked:
Hi Oleg,

The fast restore is still under development. It is not done yet. The status is not implemented at all, although its progress can be viewed from trace event with prefix “FastRestore”.

I don’t have plan to work on this in short term, but it is still a very high priority task for us on how to restore a TB-level cluster as fast as possible.

link_counts.title: Status of backup process, new design, and getting involved

posts.name: Subramaniam R
posts.cooked: Looks like fast-restore made it to 6.3. Is there any benchmarking available with the new algorithm ?

posts.name: Matias Holte
posts.cooked:
Are there any instructions to how we should perform fast restore?

From Backup, Restore, and Replication for Disaster Recovery — FoundationDB 6.3, it looks like I have to use --partitioned_log_experimental to obtain a backup that is compatible with performant restore. However, when I try it out, it crashes the cluster.

fdbbackup start -t fastRestore -z --partitioned_log_experimental -s 86400 -C /var/dynamic-conf/cluster-file -d 'blobstore://minio:public-minio-password@minio-gateway.timeseries.svc:9000/automatic_backups/fastrestore2021-07-02?bucket=foundationdb-backup-container&sc=0'

It runs fine in the start, when it is writing range bytes. But when it starts to write log bytes, the pods in the cluster starts to fail Last logged error: BackupFailed: connection_failed

I’m running on a kubernetes cluster with the fdb kubernetes operator. The cluster is small (~20 GB), has lots of capacity, and is not in use otherwise.

link_counts.title: Backup, Restore, and Replication for Disaster Recovery — FoundationDB 6.3

posts.name: Matias Holte
posts.cooked:
Found the problem - the new backup process sends data from the cluster, not just the backup agents. So I had to make a new exception to the firewall.

Would still be nice with some improved documentation to the new process

posts.name: Oleg Samarin
posts.cooked:
This github project FastRestore · GitHub
shows the progres in developement of the Fast/Performant Restore

posts.name: Oleg Samarin
posts.cooked: Hello! I see that the project FastRestore · GitHub is closed now. Does it mean that FastRestore is ready for use now? If so, where can I read how to run it?

posts.name: Meng Xu
posts.cooked: Nope. The project is paused due to the lack of staffs and we are positioned to do other projects.
